intro: Priva boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian priva, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
